text: Cnephasia abrasana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in Europe, where it has been recorded from Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Bulgaria, Romania, North Macedonia, Greece, Slovakia, Slovenia, Austria, Italy and Lithuania and on Corsica. It is also found in the Near East.Fauna Europaea The wingspan is 16–19 mm. Adults have been recorded on wing in June and July. The larvae feed on Achillea millefolium. Larvae can be found in April. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1842 Category:Cnephasia
title: Cnephasia abrasana
